agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Health TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, March 20, 2019 PLACE: E2.026 CHAIR: Rep. Senfronia Thompson The chair may limit testimony time and the number of testifying witnesses as necessary to ensure consideration of posted and pending business, especially if testimony would cause the public hearing to extend into the next calendar day. HB 577 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to dispenser requirements for refilling prescriptions for certain controlled substances. HB 531 Miller Relating to the retention by hospitals and physicians of medical records of a sexual assault victim. HB 921 Rosenthal Relating to the intake and disposition records of animal shelters and releasing agencies. HB 1255 Hinojosa Relating to patient medical records regarding maternal death. HB 1256 Phelan Relating to access by certain persons to a first responder's immunization history during a disaster. HB 1264 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to pharmacist communications to prescribing practitioners regarding certain dispensed biological products. HB 1318 Moody Relating to the provision of mental health services to persons younger than 18 years of age. HB 1418 Phelan Relating to disease prevention and preparedness information for emergency medical services personnel on certification or recertification. HB 1424 Guerra Relating to a local agreement with the Department of State Health Services to improve laboratory capabilities in border counties. HB 1425 Guerra Relating to the duration of laboratory support for testing of vector-borne infectious diseases in border counties. HB 1532 Meyer Relating to the regulation of certain health organizations certified by the Texas Medical Board; providing an administrative penalty. HB 1641 Button | et al. Relating to the provision of information to certain women enrolled in the Healthy Texas Women program. HB 1668 Allison Relating to the licensing and regulation of pharmacists and pharmacies. HB 1710 Ramos Relating to discussing with a patient the risks of certain controlled substance prescriptions. HB 1738 Guillen Relating to telehealth and home telemonitoring services, including the provision of those services under Medicaid. HB 1866 Davis, Yvonne Relating to the prescribing of opioids for acute pain. HB 1915 Zerwas | et al. Relating to a state plan for education on and treatment of Alzheimer's disease and related disorders. HB 2028 Johnson, Julie Relating to the provision of information to certain women enrolled in the Healthy Texas Women program. HB 2029 Johnson, Julie Relating to the automatic enrollment of certain women in the Healthy Texas Women program. HB 2032 Turner, John | et al. Relating to the health literacy advisory committee and health literacy in the state health plan. HB 2041 Oliverson | et al. Relating to the regulation of freestanding emergency medical care facilities. HB 2089 Coleman Relating to a change of name and vital statistics information for an adult. HB 2107 Capriglione Relating to information provided by a local health jurisdiction on food regulation. HB 2174 Zerwas Relating to controlled substance prescriptions under the Texas Controlled Substances Act; authorizing a fee. HB 2255 Darby Relating to the sharing of newborn and infant hearing screening results and the provision of information to parents following a screening. HB 2425 Kacal Relating to the authority of physicians to delegate to certain pharmacists the implementation and modification of a patient's drug therapy. HB 2454 Price Relating to continuing education requirements for certain health professionals regarding pain management and the prescribing of opioids. HB 2594 Holland | et al. Relating to disposal of prescription drugs by hospice service providers. HB 2742 Neave Relating to an audit of health care providers in the Healthy Texas Women program. HB 2811 Price Relating to the prescribing of controlled substances and dangerous drugs for acute pain. HB 3092 Paul Relating to notice of an epizootic infectious disease occurring in an animal shelter. HCR 42 Wu Designating February 26 as Bone Marrow, Blood, and Organ Donation Registry Day for a 10-year period beginning in 2019. HCR 43 Guillen Designating February as Kidney Health Awareness Month for a 10-year period beginning in 2019. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
